primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: God intervenes in human history to replace failing, self-serving political systems with a divine governance of justice and compassion.

tekstueel_bewijs: I will seek out my sheep.
I will feed them in justice.

object.identificatie: Justice and Compassion (The restoration of the sheep)
tekstueel_bewijs: The final issue of government is justice.
One gets what one needs in order to live.

zender.identificatie: The Sovereign God (The Voice from the Throne)
tekstueel_bewijs: Yahweh has a right to speak.

ontvanger.identificatie: The Sheep (The marginal, weak, and needy)
tekstueel_bewijs: The weak you have not strengthened.
The poor have their debts cancelled.
ontvanger.positie_hoorder: The hearer is positioned as a 'Reflective Citizen' who must choose to identify with the Receiver (sheep) or the Subject's mandate.

helper.identificatie: The New David / Jesus of Nazareth
tekstueel_bewijs: I will set up over them one shepherd, my servant David.
In Jesus of Nazareth... the real shepherd has come.
helper.rol_van_god: God is the Subject who acts through the Helper (Jesus).

tegenstander.identificatie: Self-serving Kings/Systems of Greed and Fear
tekstueel_bewijs: Governments which are self-serving and which practice greed.
The rulers of this age want to reduce the claims of Jesus.
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: The opponent is not just bad individuals but a 'system of value' and 'public practice' that resists God's sovereignty.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The response of the church to God's sovereignty: feeding the sheep as an act of love for Jesus.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: The Church/Hearer
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The primary program (God's rule) establishes the reality; the secondary program (Church's obedience) is the response to the question 'Do you love me?'

voorbeelden_mens_subject: We American Christians are in a crisis.

voorbeelden: They did not want such a public order.
Rethink, to think as we have not thought before.
Admit together that we... are in a crisis.
We will be freed to think in new ways.

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon focuses on 'Knowing' (Savoir) the new reality of God's reign to break the 'illusion' of the old system.

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: From S2 (Greed/Fear) through ~S1 (Private faith) to S1 (Divine Justice).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: The tension is resolved by the 'Decree from the Throne' which declares the old throne vacant.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: High; the sermon emphasizes that the old system is 'in big trouble from God'.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: While highly ethical, the sermon is grace-oriented because the 'engine' of the story is God's sovereign intervention (I, I myself). The human response is a derivative of God's established kingdom.

indicatoren_genade.indicator: God as active Subject of restoration
indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: I will seek the lost... I will bind up the crippled.

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: David is not used as a moral example to follow, but as a structural type for the 'New David' (Jesus) who enacts God's rule.
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: Theocentric: Jesus is the Shepherd who does what the human kings failed to do.

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Relief from the burden of maintaining a failing national 'illusion'.
identificatie_patroon.theologische_implicatie: The Church exists within the 'already' of Christ's kingdom.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: Strong integration of the Ezekiel text with contemporary political crisis and Christology.
spanning_punten: The transition from God's direct rule to the 'New David' (Jesus) to the hearer's 'Patriotism'.

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: The new government is at work... unsettling all that has been routine.

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: The sermon relies on the 'Truth of the Gospel' rather than the Spirit's power.

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: Severe; sin is seen as systemic greed and fear that blinds the nation.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The sermon successfully maintains God as the primary Subject of the 'Sovereign Decree'.

identificatie_herstel.problematische_identificatie: The hearer might identify too much with the 'Kings' (Opponents) leading to guilt-driven moralism.
identificatie_herstel.voorgestelde_identificatie: The 'Sheep' who are sought by God.
identificatie_herstel.strategie: Emphasize that the hearer is first the one being 'bound up' before being the one who 'feeds'.

modale_balans.concrete_suggestie: Include how the 'New David' grants the power to act, not just the mandate to think.

narratieve_hierarchie_herstel.voorgestelde_structuur: Soteriology (God's rule) clearly precedes Ethics (Feeding sheep).

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: A masterclass in theocentric preaching that refuses to let the human subject take over the active verbs of salvation.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: Rhetorical analysis would focus on the 'Ho, shepherds' hook; Greimas shows the Subject-switch from Kings to Yahweh.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis explains Ezekiel's context; Greimas explains how the text's 'engine' drives the contemporary hearer.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Reveals that the sermon's power comes from the 'Axis of Transmission' (God as Sender of a new value system).

appendices.notities: The sermon avoids the 'Exemplarism' trap by focusing on the office of the Shepherd rather than the character of David.
